user_stories.title: As a Quantitative Analyst, I want to define strategy parameters so that I can create various trading algorithms.
user_stories.description: This story focuses on defining the fields necessary to describe a trading strategy, including its name, description, entry conditions, exit conditions, risk management rules, and associated performance metrics.
acceptance_criteria: The system allows defining a unique strategy name.
The system allows specifying entry conditions (e.g., indicators, price action).
The system allows specifying exit conditions (e.g., stop loss, take profit, time-based).
The system accommodates different risk management parameters (e.g., position sizing, max drawdown).
The system captures strategy description and creation date.

tasks.title: Design Strategy data model schema
tasks.description: Define fields and data types for Strategy entity including name, description, entry_conditions (JSON), exit_conditions (JSON), risk_management_rules (JSON), creation_date, last_updated_date.

tasks.title: Implement Strategy entity in ORM
tasks.description: Create the Strategy model using chosen ORM (e.g., SQLAlchemy, Django ORM).

tasks.title: Develop Unit tests for Strategy model
tasks.description: Write unit tests to ensure correct data type validation and field constraints for the Strategy model.

tasks.title: Integrate Strategy model with database migration tool
tasks.description: Ensure the Strategy model changes can be applied via database migrations (e.g., Alembic, Django Migrations).

user_stories.title: As a Quantitative Analyst, I want to save a new trading strategy so that it can be stored and later retrieved.
user_stories.description: This story covers the ability for a user to persist a newly defined trading strategy object into the database.
acceptance_criteria: A new strategy can be successfully saved to the database.
The system prevents saving strategies with duplicate names.
Validation errors are returned if required fields are missing during save.
The saved strategy can be retrieved by its unique identifier.

tasks.title: Implement API endpoint for creating strategies
tasks.description: Develop a RESTful API endpoint (e.g., POST /strategies) for accepting and persisting new strategy data.

tasks.title: Add data validation logic for new strategy creation
tasks.description: Implement server-side validation to ensure all mandatory fields are present and correctly formatted before saving.

tasks.title: Develop service layer for strategy persistence
tasks.description: Create a service layer function responsible for interacting with the ORM to save the strategy object.

tasks.title: Write integration tests for strategy creation
tasks.description: Create tests that verify the API endpoint correctly processes and stores new strategies in the database.

user_stories.title: As a Developer, I want to ensure strategy data integrity so that the trading system relies on consistent and accurate information.
user_stories.description: This technical story focuses on implementing database constraints and validation rules to maintain the integrity and consistency of strategy data within the database.
acceptance_criteria: Strategy names are unique within the database.
Required fields (e.g., strategy_name) cannot be null.
Conditional fields are properly validated (e.g., entry/exit conditions are valid JSON).
Database schema migrations can be applied without data loss for existing strategies (if applicable).

tasks.title: Add unique constraint to strategy name field
tasks.description: Apply a unique constraint to the 'name' field in the database schema definition.

tasks.title: Set 'NOT NULL' constraints for critical strategy fields
tasks.description: Ensure fields like 'name' and 'creation_date' have NOT NULL constraints.

tasks.title: Implement database-level JSON validation (if applicable)
tasks.description: If chosen database supports, add JSON validation constraints for complex JSON fields like entry_conditions or risk_management_rules.

tasks.title: Document database schema changes
tasks.description: Update schema documentation to reflect new constraints and field definitions.
